metadata.name: V.Mountains #85
metadata.description:
V.Mountains is an abstract representation of the turbulence and chaos of our life.



The mountain is a symbol of the way that life is constantly in flux,

of the way that we are constantly trying to make sense of the world around us.



The mountain is a source of inspiration, a place of refuge, a source of strength.

It is a place where we can go to reflect on our lives, to find peace and solace.



The mountain is a symbol of hope.

It is a reminder that, no matter how dark and cold the world may be, there is always a chance for new beginnings.



The mountain is a symbol of the human spirit, and of our ability to persevere in the face of adversity.

It is a representation of our journey through life, with all of its ups and downs.

It is a reminder that, no matter how difficult the path may be,
we can always reach the summit if we are willing to put in the hard work.



Created in Vanilla Javascript.


S - to download image.


Libraries used:

noise.js by Joseph Gentle.
Javascript-Voronoi by Raymond Hill.

metadata.name: (recombination/perspectives)-I: Horizons #76
metadata.description:
🌊 🌞 🌈 🌅


    ( r e c o m b i n a t i o n  /  p e r s p e c t i v e s ) 


                     I :   H o r i z o n s


                            ✨ 🧬 🧡 ⏲







-----
* What/How *

2 560 000 particles are subjected to a succession of 64 energy bursts which scatters the points through space. 
The algorithm then stores 3 configurations of points, forming an entangled coherent system.
After few seconds multiple observation modalities are then selected sequentially to allow for dynamic and contemplative visualization.

-----
* Mint preview *

Minter will get a 2160x2160 PNG bitmap and an infinite randomly deterministic animation.

-----
* Technics *

This experience is designed to be executed on a recent GPU (>2016) and displayed on 16/9 screens from FHD to 8K+ (1920x1080 → 7680x4320) at 60FPS for infinite duration.

- JavaScript / ThreeJS / WebGL / GLSL
- Unique generative, random and determinist animation (animation is seeded by the fxhash mint hash)
- Infinite animation
- Animation sequences duration between 6 and 60 seconds.

-----
* Controls *

Keyboard "Space" : take a PNG capture of the current view frame (same ratio as window, max 1920x1080)

Keyboard "X" : skip current animation sequence / next sequence

-----
* URL modifiers *

"&fastdemo=on"
Forces animation sequences to last 10 seconds instead of random durations.

"&slow=on"
Forces animation sequences to last 1 minute instead of random durations.

"&static=on"
Disables animation automatic start. Press "X" to start animations.


-----
@HAL09999 – January 25th, 2023

metadata.name: Successful Waves #2
Stargazer #78
metadata.description:
Stargazer seeking something out of dark sky.

Live view options:
- Press "s" key: Saves the image
- Press "f" key: Shows in fullscreen
- Press "1" to "4" key: Explores different scenes

Depending on the device / browser you run it on, it may take some time for the drawing to complete.
Made with p5js and shaders.

December 2022
ykxotkx

metadata.name: Wishing Wells #7
metadata.description:
Deep in the Forest a Wishing Well...
You make a wish to escape this dark place.
Each piece generated at Random using 6 layers to create a unique artwork. Created by Tales 2023

metadata.name: Vinciō #25
metadata.description:
"Vinciō", a means of binding, fastening, band, bond, rope, cord, fetter and tie.
This piece is a complex convergence of lines that eventually creates a unique pattern. There are different colors with light and dark backgrounds as well as different dimensions and styles.

This work can be printed in large dimensions,
so to see the artwork in higher quality, open it in live view and add “&res=1 to 10” to the URL.

The preview is automatically captured after 25 seconds of the animation.

Made with p5js.

metadata.name: Drawing Machines #17 #198
metadata.description:
Based on the concept on moons revolving around planets, revolving around suns, that are revolving around the universe. 

I've spent way too long making drawing machines over the years, I love watching them slowly unfold.

metadata.name: SCHNEEWALD #29
metadata.description:
SCHNEEWALD is the second release in a row of about 12 tree/flower generative art works, which have come together over the last 10 years.

This project explores an approach to trees with snow using a recursive algorithm and includes Three traits: a density layer for the amount of trees and another layer for the amount snow and a third for how strong the branches bend.

Rendering progress indicated on the top left border
Press [s] in live view to download a high resolution png

Artist notes:
Since I moved to Wandlitz, north of Berlin, in the middle of the "Naturpark Barnim" (https://www.barnim-naturpark.de/), in 2003,
I've done a lot of exploring nearby nature. In addition to the beautiful lake and heath landscapes, I fell in love with the wild acacia forests. These strange trees, sometimes more like huge wild grasses, grow so wildly into each other.

I experienced it in all sorts of seasonal change, packed with snow is definitely among the most amazing! 

While playing around with different branching system code snippets, a more and more complex image composition came together. The final script for this project on fx(hash) was finally given more randomness for a wider range of different outputs and an additional random grain filter.

Project link: https://e-art.co/project/schneewald/

Many thanks to jesse (jbird) for the good collaboration, which ultimately made it possible to get this work released.

copyright © 2023 | license cc 4.0 BY-NC-ND

metadata.name: GRAVITATE #28
metadata.description:
Each piece in this collection is made from the simple concept of layering grids of circles. The varying grid sizes, circle sizes, positions and colors combine to create interesting dithering effects. There are seven color palettes in the algorithm and these range from low contrast, muted palettes (e.g. Mystic Sands) to high contrast, super saturated palettes (e.g. Inferno).

- - -

GRAVITATE is my first generative art collection and was made using only p5.js.

- - -

Commands:
Press `1` to save a low-res PNG 1200x1800
Press `2` to save a high-res PNG 4800x7200

Note that it may take up to 10secs for the image render to complete.

metadata.name: Here When You Need Me #198
metadata.description:
'Here When You Need Me' is a generative system that creates...

Good question, and I think the answer is up to you. Jewels? Reflections? The Sand in a Life's Hourglass?

Who knows. The truth is that I didn't have anything in mind for the project, and where it has ended up was purely through exploration, and a refinement of simple methods.

By the end, it has become exactly what I needed it to be, and the results of this project give me an encouragement that is difficult to explain.

Now, one of the primary features of the project is your ability to make it what you need. Several URL arguments are explained below that will allow you to tweak your edition's distortion and resolution.

15% of primary sales will be donated to 'Girls Who Code'
15% of primary sales will be donated to 'Cure Parkinson's'

10% of royalties will go to 'Girls Who Code'
10% of royalties will go to 'Cure Parkinson's'
10% of royalties will go to the original minter

Thank you everyone.


Options
-------
Parameters can be appended to the live URL to adjust the output's distortion, resolution, border size, and border color. These are all fun to play with, and can be used in combination to showcase the variability and potential of each piece.

'&distortion=#': Adjust distortion, any value from 0.0 to 3.0 (Use 0 to see a 'flat' version of the image)
'&resolution=#': Multiplier for width/height, any value from 0.1 to 6.0 (Soft max of 3.9)
'&borderSize=#': Multiplier for border size, any value from 0.0 to 3.0 (Use 0 for no border)
'&borderColor=ffffff': Custom border color, any 6 character hex code (Do not include '#')

An example of using multiple options would be '&resolution=2&distortion=.5'

Please check the linked fx(text) article for detailed examples on using these options.


Distortion
----------
I wanted to provide some amount of control to take advantage of the possibilities of generative art. 'Here When You Need Me' starts off at a certain point, but allows you to adjust the distortion to your favorite level.

Using '&distortion=0' will show the underlying shapes.


Resolution / Printing
---------------------
'Here When You Need Me' looks best with at least '&resolution=2' and is designed to support printing. Remember that parameters can be provided to adjust the border attributes as well.

Ideally, you should aim for 300 'pixels per inch' for a decent quality print. Default resolution is 1800x2400.

'&resolution=1' -> 6"x8"
'&resolution=2' -> 12"x16"

Some quick math will give you the correct modifier if you start with the width in inches of your desired print. 

(inches) * (ppi) / (default width)

An important note, the maximum resolution modifier I've had success with is 3.9 because of the browser's image size limitations, but the capability is still in the code to go higher in case it is helpful to someone.

If you have your edition printed, please share with me because it would make me incredibly happy to see it!


---------
Thank you to everyone for your support and contributions. 

I put way more detail in this description than I intended, but if you want even more, you can read about the development and potential of this project in the accompanying fx(text) article, once it is written.

Created by Walter Anderson (@noxiarb)

metadata.name: Proto alphabet #127
metadata.description:
For more than 4000 years, before Lineal A in Crete, proto alphabets were created. They freed man from the chains of evolution and gave a way to record the rhythm of the passage of time.

As recursion generates a grammar, recursion generates the strokes that shape the following proto alphabets, which attempt to record the passage of time.

Time is the substance I am made of. Time is a river which sweeps me along, but I am the river; it is a tiger which destroys me, but I am the tiger; it is a fire which consumes me, but I am the fire. - Jorge Luis Borges


Desde hace más de 4000 años, antes Lineal A en Creta, proto alfabetos fueron creados. Liberaron al hombre de las cadenas de la evolución y dieron una forma para registrar el ritmo del paso del tiempo.

Como la recursividad genera una gramática, la recursividad genera los trazos que dan forma a los siguientes proto alfabetos, los cuales intentan registrar el paso del tiempo.

El tiempo es la sustancia de que estoy hecho. El tiempo es un río que me arrebata, pero yo soy el río; es un tigre que me destroza, pero yo soy el tigre; es un fuego que me consume, pero yo soy el fuego. - Jorge Luis Borges


Controls (in live view):
- Press s to get a PNG file
- Press S to get a SVG file

Artwork by x0y0z0 @x0y0z0tn (2023)

metadata.name: Bayeux #89
metadata.description:
Each output is generated by layering Blender renders.

'Bayeux' explores the bold simplicity and beauty of Bauhaus design ideas, with an arrangment of simple bauhaus-inspired shapes in a colorful, striking design. The addition of smaller shapes arranged in a checkerboard style gives some outputs an heraldic feel.

To download a 1500x2000px PNG:
Click/tap 'open', then click/tap the image to make a "Download image" button appear.

metadata.name: Sticks #199
metadata.description:
Francesco Forcellini, January 2023, Milano, Italy.

To save an image with the size of the window press S once the image is fully rendered.
To save a Hi-Resolution image 4500px x 6000px press H and wait, the page will reload and start to render.

Built using p5js. Published under CC-BY-NC-4.0 license. Please see the License.md file for license details.

metadata.name: Reaching #38
metadata.description:
Reach for the stars.

However impossible it may seem, there's always a way. As long as you believe.
Everybody has a way to their stars, and the only way to reach it is to try as hard as you can and believe in yourself. I will forever live by this and believe in it.

A couple of the palettes used in this piece were adapted from the ever great Studio Yorktown, thank you for providing these incredible combinations of colors :)

--

Press spacebar or right click to save an image.

--

Reaching is a piece I dedicate to my recently passed grandmother. Rest in piece, we love you and miss you.

metadata.name: Specter of Fears #146
metadata.description:
In the dreamlike landscape of our minds, the specter of fears is like a wraith, ever-present and ethereal. It whispers in our ear, reminding us of all the things we dare not face. It is a shadow that falls across our hearts, casting a pall of doubt and uncertainty. But even as it haunts us, we must remember that it is a part of us. We must learn to accept its presence, and to use it to our advantage. For fear is not always a curse, it is a guide that shows us where we must grow stronger. It is a companion that walks with us through the dark night, illuminating the path ahead. By embracing our fears, we find the courage to face them, and to overcome them. We find the strength to live fully, to love fiercely, and to pursue our dreams with abandon.

Controls :

• Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

———————

Specter of Fears by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2023
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
